page.description: Allows you to define aliases for use in a Desktop application using Xbasic. Aliases in a Desktop application are normally defined using the View/Settings/Aliases dialog. This function allows you to define the aliases programmatically.
page.discussion: Takes a CRLF delimited list of aliases defined using this format: aliasname|path. Allows you to define aliases for use in a Desktop application using Xbasic. Aliases in a Desktop application are normally defined using the View/Settings/Aliases dialog. This function allows you to define the aliases programmatically.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script (which would typically be placed in the Autoexec) will define two new aliases:
section.example: dim myaliases as c myaliases = <<%txt% [server]|\\masterserver\images [server2]|\\slaveserver\images2 %txt% a5_defineAliases(myaliases)
